text: Volunteers would work for only a few hours, have their temperatures taken before entering the facility and will receive their own masks and gloves for the job. Sewing experience would be well received, however, those who don’t know how to sew will receive training.

.@LBHealth in Baltimore needs volunteers over the next several weeks to help make masks for health care providers. Masks will be made near Northwest Hospital in Randallstown. To volunteer, sign up here: https://t.co/YegYhkEnOm.

A quick video message to close out the week.

Be safe. Be well. https://t.co/jX1vnG6czW

By taking action to flatten the curve, we will be better equipped to fight the virus, and eventually – with all of us working together – life will get back to normal.

Here’s a brief roundup of the latest #COVID_19 developments. #SarbanesStandard https://t.co/OAeYJntW5e

To fight #COVID_19 and to save lives, Marylanders are making significant sacrifices. I want to thank you and your families for following the advice of public health officials and staying home to help slow the spread of the virus.

As the number of #COVID_19 cases and deaths continue to rise, it’s incredibly important for all of us to follow the guidance of public health officials and #StayHome to slow the spread of the virus. https://t.co/IESA6ndmPp

With the bipartisan #CARESAct, we delivered critical resources to our frontline health care workers. Moving forward, we must continue to support our health care workforce and ensure they have all of the tools and equipment they need to fight the virus. https://t.co/TVYsunyTgp

The #CARESAct provides $350 billion in forgivable loans and $10 billion in grants for small businesses and nonprofits. See here for more information about how small business owners and nonprofits can access these resources: https://t.co/hAPgpCZMw6. https://t.co/i0JsdUXQ1o

To stop the virus from spreading and to save lives, we must make these important sacrifices. By taking action now to slow the spread, we will be better equipped to fight the virus and slowly get back to normal. But it’s going to take action from each and every one of us.

Maryland residents should not leave their homes for any reason aside from essential work, to get food or groceries, to get prescriptions or for other fundamental reasons. Any Marylander who defies the order will be subject to a misdemeanor.
The State of Maryland has issued a “Stay at Home” order for all residents. It will go into effect at 8:00 PM this evening. https://t.co/o93tyK7ktS

A few words on today's passage of the CARES Act, a bipartisan stimulus package that will deliver robust resources to hospitals, health care providers, states and local governments, along with economic relief for American workers and small businesses. #CARESActStatement #COVID_19 https://t.co/kGWeVDPLlm

Yesterday, I joined the Maryland Congressional Delegation in announcing $1,194,822 in federal funding to help Community Health Centers (CHCs) across Maryland respond to the coronavirus. #COVID_19 https://t.co/rYKrlgy3QE
Here’s a brief recap of recent developments at the federal, state and local levels to address the coronavirus pandemic. #COVID_19 https://t.co/7FsIQbbswS

Moving forward, we must continue to take appropriate steps to ensure that our hospitals, health care providers, doctors, nurses, first responders and frontline health workers have the resources, equipment and support they need to fight the virus

At the end of the day, the only way we’re going to get to the other side of this public health emergency and get our economy back into gear is by boosting the capacity of our health care system and fighting the virus effectively across the country.
And we won more resources for state and local governments – like those in Maryland – that have been leading the fight against the coronavirus. https://t.co/ea5XxwvZEe
We also took steps to expand loans, grants and relief programs for small businesses. This includes making rent, mortgage and utility costs eligible for SBA loan forgiveness.
We expanded Unemployment Insurance to match the average paycheck of laid-off or furloughed workers. https://t.co/Ukwjzu4fpk

We boosted funding for hospitals, health care providers and health care workers, so that they can access the personal protective equipment, medical supplies and devices – especially ventilators – that they need to save lives and protect our communities. https://t.co/0l3WMUwgw9
Instead, Democrats secured important changes that put American workers and #FamiliesFirst. https://t.co/0l3WMUwgw9
As we negotiated the bill, @HouseDemocrats and @SenateDems pushed back on Republicans’ efforts to provide secret bailouts to corporations – including the Trump Organization. https://t.co/K6uKj9ahFw

Today, we took another significant step forward in our #COVID_19 response by passing a wide-ranging bill that will not only inject critical funding into our health care system, but also expand and enhance key programs to protect workers and families. https://t.co/TKLB695HBY

Over the last several weeks, Congress has acted swiftly to address the coronavirus crisis by helping shore up America’s health care system and by providing financial support to American workers and small businesses impacted by the pandemic. #COVID_19
More good news for Maryland in our fight against the coronavirus. #COVID_19 https://t.co/Il0zNTzm35

As we celebrate #MarylandDay today – at a distance from one another, of course – let’s take this opportunity to remember that we’re all in this together and that by helping one another and taking important individual steps, we can overcome this crisis.

In Baltimore and across Maryland, local distillers are using their skills and equipment to fill production gaps and make hand sanitizer for health care providers and other critical organizations, like Meals on Wheels. https://t.co/5qJF4A90kE
Every single day, Marylanders are taking important steps to help keep our communities safe during this public health crisis.

Maryland has announced that schools will remain closed for another four weeks, through April 24. https://t.co/TCxIT6w1uj

Today, my colleagues and I urged President Trump to swiftly approve Maryland’s request for a statewide Major Disaster Declaration as a result of the coronavirus crisis. Approving Maryland’s request would make our state eligible for emergency funding. https://t.co/An7IxGEndm

Beginning today, @YCentralMD will provide child care for the children of frontline health care workers and first responders. The centers will remain closed to the general public. Parents who qualify can register at https://t.co/Qi1KzRc9k6.
Some hopeful news about #COVID_19 from the world-class researchers at @JHUAPL (located in Maryland’s Third Congressional District). https://t.co/WIvERoiDZS

Today, I urged @FEMA to approve Maryland’s request for two federal medical stations in Baltimore. These units would increase Maryland’s hospital capacity by 300 beds and deliver approximately 1,096 ventilators. https://t.co/5ww6Sy5Yys

Marylanders can receive real-time updates, tips and resources about the coronavirus by texting MdReady to 898211. #COVID_19

On Friday, I joined hundreds of lawmakers in calling on House and Senate leaders to boost federal funding for Community Health Centers and other vital community level health programs as part of the comprehensive federal response to coronavirus. https://t.co/JZun20hFAr

Marylanders: @MarylandConnect has opened a Coronavirus Emergency Special Enrollment Period for people who’d like to sign up for health insurance. This special enrollment period runs from now until April 15. You can explore health plans and sign up below. https://t.co/zmccMNPVmm

We cannot allow President Trump and Republicans in Congress to take away these vital health care protections and benefits from the American people – especially now, when we need it the most. #ProtectOurCare

All of these vast improvements and critical benefits are under attack by the Trump Administration and Congressional Republicans, who first tried (and failed) to repeal the ACA, then moved to sabotage it and now hope to unravel it through the courts.

Health insurance plans must provide essential benefits like maternity care and prescription drugs. Doctors and hospitals have reduced the rate of patient harm and improved the delivery of care. And importantly, the ACA has considerably slowed health care costs.

Millions more Americans have the opportunity to #GetCovered and access high quality and affordable care. Hundreds of millions of Americans with pre-existing conditions can no longer be denied coverage or be forced to pay higher deductibles and premiums.
As we face the alarming threat of the coronavirus pandemic, we are reminded of the critical importance of the ACA and the improvements it’s made to our health care system.
10 years ago today, President @BarackObama signed the Affordable Care Act into law. https://t.co/6tVMjGyKKV
Here’s another great example. https://t.co/EsrIP0oa83
It’s inspiring. And it’s an important signal that, by working together and helping one another, we will eventually get through this crisis. #COVID_19

Every single day, it seems, we face more bad news about the growing outbreak of the coronavirus. But in these trying times, ordinary Americans in Baltimore and across Maryland are stepping up to make a difference and helping keep our communities safe. #COVID_19

🔘 The Maryland Secretary of Health has activated the Maryland Responds Medical Reserve Corps, a 5,000-person force of medical and public health volunteers.

🔘 All gatherings of more than 50 people are prohibited. (No exceptions.)

🔘 As of 5:00 PM today, all bars, restaurants, theaters, fitness centers and spas Maryland must close.

Each and every one of us can do our part too. 

☑️ We can limit our travel and our movements. 

☑️ We can avoid large crowds. 

☑️ We can frequently wash our hands and sanitize our work and living spaces.
These are extraordinary actions, but they will help mitigate the spread of coronavirus in our state.

➡️ All non-essential state workers will telework.

➡️ No visits will be allowed at state prisons.

➡️ The Port of Baltimore’s cruise ship terminal will close.

➡️ The Maryland National Guard has been activated.

➡️ All Maryland public schools will close from Monday, March 16 through Friday, March 27.

➡️ All Maryland hospitals will restrict visitors – one person per patient.

➡️ All events with more than 250 people are canceled.
Today, Maryland has announced several important steps to help stop the spread of the virus and keep Marylanders safe.

In the coming days, I will provide you with regular updates on steps we are taking in Congress to address the coronavirus outbreak. I will also share information on efforts being undertaken in Maryland by our state and local health agencies.

This is obviously an unsettling time for our country and for all Marylanders. But I have every confidence that, by pulling together, we will get to the other side of this public health crisis. #Covid_19

Moving forward, the Trump Administration must work with Congress to further de-escalate tensions with Iran and establish a coherent and sustainable strategy to promote peace and stability across the region.

Congress cannot allow the President to drag our country into another military conflict without the consent of the American people. Today, we took a decisive step to rein in the President’s ability to initiate war with Iran.

In spite of this, the President’s impulse is to heighten brinkmanship with Iran, and to do so without appropriate Congressional authorization and in violation of established protocols for consulting Congressional leaders.
After nearly two decades of endless war, the American people are wary of additional military entanglements in the Middle East.
Today, I voted to pass H.Con.Res. 83, a War Powers Resolution to limit President Trump’s ability to engage in a military conflict with Iran. https://t.co/Sc3bhjsSSN

Americans deserve better. Their representatives in Congress must be briefed immediately by Administration officials and be made full partners in fashioning a responsible and sustainable policy toward Iran.
The killing of Soleimani is yet another instance of President Trump acting impulsively on the international stage and then scrambling to justify his conduct after the fact.
The Administration must move quickly to protect Americans from retaliatory attacks and brief Congress on its strategy for containing the fallout from Iran and its proxy forces across the Middle East.

However, I am deeply concerned that this provocative action by President Trump will put the lives of even more American service members, diplomats, foreign service officers and citizens abroad at risk.
There’s no question that Soleimani was an enemy of the United States. Over a period of many years, he was responsible for the deaths of hundreds of Americans.
It was reckless for President Trump to take such action without appropriate Congressional authorization and in violation of established protocols for consulting Congressional leaders.
The killing of Qasem Soleimani has led predictably to a dangerous escalation of tensions with Iran. https://t.co/j6vfjfvjhY
